text: Wall Street had its worst day since the
financial crisis today another wild day
of trading has just ended on Wall Street
the barrel is just rung ending one of
the wildest days the Dow Jones
Industrial Average had its biggest
single day fall ever at close it had
lost more than 1,100 points which means
it was down 4.6 percent while the stock
sell-off started early last week real
trouble began on Friday the trigger was
the US jobs report we had a strong
January jobs report which showed wages
growing faster than expected now
typically if wages go up inflation does
as well and the Federal Reserve will
have to raise interest rates to control
it that's really at the bottom of this
slide a fear among traders that interest
rates will rise more quickly than
expected the market fall is bad news for
any investments or retirement accounts
you may have tied up in US stocks and
it's also a jolt for the man in the
white house
already we are seeing the White House
trying to distance itself saying that
the president is focused on long-term
fundamentals which remain exceptionally
strong your taxes are going way down
factories are coming back unemployment
claims have hit a 45 year low
everything's coming back they all want
to be where the action is but after
months of taking credit for the record
highs markets have reached since he took
over President Trump now seems to be
choosing to e gonna own this milestone a
record slide
